messages.title: Action from RICHARD PALMER
messages.content: Dear Residents, I am your local Parliamentary candidate for UKIP in this year’s general election. I believe in this country and know people are feeling let down by the other parties. Once we leave the EU Britain will prosper. We can start to rebuild our universities, creating a society that enables everyone to achieve their potential. We can enter world trade agreements and can manage our own destiny by developing social and democratic structures for us, not the EU.

messages.title: ABOUT RICHARD
messages.content: Richard has lived in the constituency for nearly 30 years, he works locally in the community. He is a film producer and former NHS Paramedic based at Queenborough Corner ambulance station.

messages.title: GOVERNMENT SLASHES LOCAL AUTHORITY FUNDING
messages.content: The easy option the Coalition Government is taking to reduce their deficit is to slash the funding of local authorities and then they restrict Councils' ability to raise revenue to pay for the services, forcing cuts on everyone. This means the burden in cuts in services that people rely on is aimed at Councils rather than the government. This Coalition Government has seen more interference in local authorities than any previous government. Local people should be able to decide local priorities - not Westminster politicians.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Belief that Britain will prosper outside the EU by rebuilding universities and creating a society that enables everyone to achieve their potential, entering world trade agreements and managing our own destiny.
Opposition to Coalition Government's reduction of funding for local authorities and restriction on Councils' ability to raise revenue, resulting in cuts on services that people rely on.

We can enter world trade agreements and can manage our own destiny by developing social and democratic structures for us, not the EU.
